data.question: What is the main application of coordination polymer (CP) glasses mentioned in the text?
data.answer: High-performance gas sieving for size-exclusive gas separation.

data.question: What are the metals used in the synthesis of CP glasses mentioned in the text?
data.answer: Zn, Cd, Cu, and Mn.

data.question: What property of CP glasses allows for their molding into grain boundary-free membranes?
data.answer: Their liquid nature under high temperature.

data.question: What is the significance of the Robeson upper bound in the context of gas separation membranes?
data.answer: It represents the trade-off between permeability and selectivity in gas separation membranes.

data.question: What method is used to fabricate CP glasses according to the text?
data.answer: The melt-quenching method.

data.question: What is the main challenge with ZIF-62 glass for gas separation as mentioned in the text?
data.answer: Its ultra-high viscosity at high vitrification temperature results in poor flowability and processability.

data.question: Why do CP glasses have potential in gas separation membranes?
data.answer: Because their locally ordered structure and ultra-microporous or microporous cavities lead to the possibility to molecularly sieve gases.

data.question: How do the viscosities of Zn-P-dmbIm compare to those of ZIF-62 glass?
data.answer: Zn-P-dmbIm has significantly lower viscosities, making it easier to process.

data.question: What enables the healing ability of CP glass membranes?
data.answer: The low viscosities of CP glasses allow for the healing of cracks via simple heating.

data.question: How does the structure of Zn-P-dmbIm contribute to its gas separation performance?
data.answer: The structure of Zn-P-dmbIm, composed of tetrahedral Zn2+ ions with mono-coordinated dmbIm and bridging phosphate, forms extended one-dimensional chains that facilitate gas separation.

data.question: What is the role of the 5,6-dmbIm ligand in the glass-forming ability of M-P-dmbIm?
data.answer: The steric hindrance by the 5,6-dmbIm ligand impedes the diffusion of atoms or ions, preventing the formation of crystalline structures.

data.question: What is the main reason for the size-exclusive effect of agZn-P-dmbIm membrane?
data.answer: The suitable pore size distribution and fast H2 diffusion pathway are the main reasons for the size-exclusive effect.

data.question: True or False: CP glasses can only be used for H2/CO2 separation.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The separation performance of CP glass membranes surpasses the Robeson upper bound.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: The healing ability of CP glass membranes compromises their gas separation performance.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The entire process of CP synthesis, membrane fabrication, and crack healing is solvent- and binder-free.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: CP glasses have higher viscosities than ZIF glasses, making them difficult to process.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The gas separation performance of CP glass membranes is unaffected by the fabrication method.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: CP glasses are only synthesized using metal acetates.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The study on CP glasses is at an advanced stage.
data.answer: False
